intro: Anisonema reticulatum, commonly known as the net-veined fern, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its delicate, finely divided leaves that give it a lacy appearance. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which are followed by small, red berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some regions as a garden plant.
